intro: Tetraphyle campestris, commonly known as the field bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Tetraphyle campestris is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
